stadium.name: The Stronghold Bailey
stadium.description: The team plays in the central bailey of Stronghold Castle, a massive fortress built on a plateau overlooking the city. The field is packed earth and cobblestone, and the crowd watches from the surrounding stone ramparts.

stats.pregame_ritual: Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Tying a red string around their pinky finger.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.

Tugging on their left earlobe three times.

stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds‚Äîpart arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Attempting to communicate with birds.

preGame:
Hello, hello, hello, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the ramparts of The Stronghold Bailey! üéôÔ∏è It is a gorgeous, blood-chilling Tuesday night, and we have reached the absolute boiling point! This is Game Three! The rubber match! The winner-take-all finale of this Losers Bracket series between The Greenwatch and the hometown favorites, The New Ravenfall Commanders! The air is thick with the smell of sweat, anticipation, and whatever fermented fish those Commanders are passing around! üêü

The atmosphere here in New Ravenfall is simply electric, folks! The popularity of the Commanders is sky-high, and the local fans are screaming loud enough to rattle the teeth of the God King Sir Artorias himself! But don't count out the Greenwatch; they might be the underdogs in the stands, but they play like demons in the dirt! I caught Goldenberg Rimola earlier trying to explain the complexities of the zone defense to a passing pigeon‚Äîlet‚Äôs hope the bird gave him some good advice! üê¶ Meanwhile, Nobe Haukom was seen plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck. That‚Äôs the kind of dedication to superstition that I love to see! üßî

The Commanders aren't taking any chances tonight. I saw Dusa Curson on her hands and knees searching for a four-leaf clover‚Äîmaybe she should be looking for a sturdier helmet instead! And Estes Adrian is currently polishing off a massive piece of honeycomb. He‚Äôs looking to 'sweeten' the deal, but the only thing sweet tonight will be the sound of bone meeting cobblestone! üçØ The 'Castle Echo' is going to make every tackle sound like the end of the world! It‚Äôs do-or-die, win-or-go-home! Grab your drinks and hold onto your souls, because we are about to see who moves on and who gets tossed into the dustbin of history! Let's play Trollball! ü¶¥üí•
postGame:
What a magnificent, bone-shattering display of high-stakes Trollball we just witnessed! üì£ The Greenwatch has done the impossible, walking into the lion's den of The Stronghold Bailey and walking out with a 3-0 shutout victory to claim the series! The hometown fans are silent, looking more dejected than Sir Tanos when he realizes he‚Äôs run out of things to stab! It was a masterclass in defensive brutality and opportunistic scoring that has sent the Commanders packing! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ

The carnage started early and it started often, folks! Right out of the gate, Dusa Curson snatched up the troll head, but the Greenwatch defense was hungrier than a pack of starving ghouls! Salahi Bushey set the tone by absolutely obliterating Moir Sass, sending them straight to the healer‚Äôs tent with an injury that had the crowd gasping! üè• It wasn't long after that Drona Jacklin decided to join the surgery team, tackling Rhett Gavrilla with such force that the poor player looked like they were trying to fold themselves into a suitcase! 

The violence just kept on rolling like a boulder down a mountain! Darin Berliner, who clearly didn't come here to make friends, found Jessalin Zobias and delivered a tackle that echoed off the castle walls like a funeral bell! üîî The Commanders were reeling, their high-and-mighty Eponore support doing absolutely nothing to stop the Greenwatch onslaught. Even the 'Castle Echo' couldn't make the Commanders' offense sound scary tonight; they were fumbling and stumbling all over the cobblestone pitch!

Then came the moment that changed the game! Goldenberg Rimola, perhaps finally understanding what that pigeon was cooing about, found himself with an opening in Center Field. With a flick of the wrist that would make a wizard jealous, he fired a long-distance 'Shoot' that zipped right through the goal for two points! üéØ The Greenwatch took a 2-0 lead, and you could practically hear the hearts of the Ravenfall fans breaking. It was a beautiful sight, truly! 

We headed into Halftime with the field looking more like a butcher's shop than an arena. Hooge Imtiaz was working overtime trying to patch the Commanders back together, while Nariko Javed was likely just enjoying the view! When the whistle blew for the second half, the Commanders tried to rally, with Jessalin Zobias making a desperate run, but Salahi Bushey was there to say 'Not in my house!' Salahi delivered another bone-crunching tackle to Jessalin, ensuring the Commanders stayed firmly under the Greenwatch's boot! üë¢

The desperation was palpable! Dusa Curson tried to spark some life back into the home team by taking out Troy Jorgan, but the Greenwatch just shrugged it off like it was a minor inconvenience. The Commanders' passing game was a disaster, with Herriott Dhiren snagging an interception from Jozef Pepe that effectively ended any hope of a comeback. It‚Äôs hard to win a game when you‚Äôre spending more time on the floor than on your feet, isn't it? üìâ

The final nail in the coffin was a thing of beauty! Rese Halpern, likely fueled by the scent of those lucky socks, took the ball and sprinted through the defense like it was made of wet paper! üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è She crossed into the End Zone and slammed that troll head home for a touchdown, pushing the lead to 3-0! The Greenwatch bench erupted, and the few traveling fans they had were making enough noise to rival a chorus of banshees! It was a total shut-out, a complete and utter dismantling of the Ravenfall favorites!

As the final whistle blew, the Commanders were left wondering what hit them. Maybe next time they should spend less time reciting epic poems and more time practicing their blocking! Theis Loredo and Fleme Alis were trying their best, but they were about as effective as a screen door on a submarine. I‚Äôve seen more fight from a litter of kittens than the Commanders showed in that final stretch! üê± It just goes to show you, popularity doesn't win games‚Äîruthless aggression does!

So, the Greenwatch moves on in the Losers Bracket, their playoff dreams still very much alive! They showed grit, they showed violence, and they showed a complete lack of respect for the 'Heroes' of Eponore! I‚Äôm sure Sir Artorias will have a lovely, long speech about 'lessons learned,' but the only lesson here is that the Greenwatch is for real! I‚Äôm going to go find where Salahi Bushey gets his morning dew; it clearly works better than whatever the Commanders were drinking! üíß

What a series! What a finish! My favorite Ebon Gate Corruptors would be proud of the sheer lack of sportsmanship shown here tonight! üòà It's a dark day for New Ravenfall, but a glorious one for fans of pure, unadulterated Trollball carnage! I‚Äôm heading to the nearest tavern to toast to the winners‚Äîand maybe mock a few Commanders fans while I‚Äôm at it! üçª

Until next Tuesday, this is Nok the Corrupter, your voice of the Everwar, signing off! Remember, if you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying! Goodnight, Osterra, and keep those healers busy! üéôÔ∏èüî•
